modules.title: Introduction & Intelligent Agents
modules.description: What is AI, the state of the art. Intelligent agents, agents and environments, concept of rationality, the nature of environments, structure of agents.

modules.title: Problem-Solving & Uninformed Search
modules.description: Problem-solving agents, example problems, searching for solutions, uninformed search strategies such as breadth-first, depth-first, etc.

modules.title: Informed Search & Logical Agents
modules.description: Informed search strategies, heuristic functions. Knowledge-based agents, the Wumpus world, logic, propositional logic, reasoning patterns in propositional logic.

modules.title: First Order Logic & Inference
modules.description: First-order logic representation revisited, syntax and semantics, using first-order logic, knowledge engineering. Propositional vs first-order inference, unification, forward chaining.

modules.title: FOL Inference & Classical Planning
modules.description: Backward chaining, resolution in first-order logic. Classical planning: definition, algorithms for planning as state-space search, planning graphs.

course_outcomes: Explain the architecture and components of intelligent agents and their interaction with the AI environment.
Apply problem-solving agents and search strategies to solve a given problem.
Illustrate logical reasoning and knowledge representation using propositional and first-order logic.
Demonstrate proficiency in representing knowledge and solving problems using first-order logic.
Describe classical planning in the context of AI, including goals, constraints, and applications.
